en.title: A Very warm welcome to Roger Pot!
en.description:
In this guide we'll provide you with all the information you need for your stay with us, from getting safely to us, to having a stress free visit, all the way through to a smooth checkout

In this easy to navigate web app, you'll find everything you need to know about the property and the local services available to you

en.title: What we love!
en.description:
The dales outside our window

 

The perfect space to relax

A place to cook and socialise over a glass of wine

Getting some well earned rest after a long days walking

en.title: What you said you love
en.description:
The reviews tell their story (no edits honest! Not even their spelling!)

"Lovely chilled four night stay, lovely hosts."

Delicious welcome pack! Clean spacious cottage with all amenities needed, from kitchen utensils to family games! Rural with gorgeous scenery, short drive into Sedbergh for few small shops, pub etc.. slightly further drive into Hawes, more shops, cafes, pubs/restaurants etc... and lovely walks.

Reviewed by Alexa5.0★Aug 2024

"Made to feel very welcome by the owner."

Charming cottage - very clean and well equipped. Lovely homemade bread and cake on arrival. Location very convenient for exploring the Yorkshire Dales.

Reviewed by Jenny5.0★Aug 2024

"Just an great place in beautiful surroundings, couldn't wish for more."

We only had a some discomfort from the midges around the house.

Bloomin midges! Apparently Nationwide problem due to period of wet weather followed by hot period. Ideal for the beasties. Gone now. Property Owner

Reviewed by Robert5.0★Jun 2024

"The owners were very friendly and helpful."

Roger Pot is a great house which has amazing views of the countryside everywhere you look. Felt very relaxed here and thanks to Paul who provided his home made bread and cake in an excellent welcome pack. Would certainly recommend staying here.

Thanks Sue. Further to quick chat I understand your info issue was to do with the rather rustic farm track up to our house. Obviously fully accessible, many small vans, non 4x4’s, low profile cars, horse box trailers and tractors use the route up but appreciate it’s useful to know Property Owner

Reviewed by Sue4.7★Jun 2024

"The accommodation was great, clean, comfortable, spectacular views from all windows and walks on the door step."

The property is provided with everything we needed and a fantastic welcome pack. Owners very helpful and welcoming. Had a great week.

Reviewed by Jill5.0★May 2024

"Great location with wonderful views and beautiful house."

Friendly and helpful owners who provided the best welcome hamper ever!

Response - Okay following our comms understand 75%’s boiled down to some dog hairs and smell on some rugs (extra effort on cleaning required Paul!!), some suggestions on extra knives/pots for the kitchen ( duly noted and actioned) and some tired garden seats (actioned straight away- new seats installed). Feedback truly always welcome Property Owner

Reviewed by Peter4.1 ★May 2024

"We had an enjoyable stay at Roger Pot."

House was in a great location for exploring that area of the dales. The house was very comfortable & we had everything we needed. Excellent welcome pack. Enclosed garden for the dog which was great. The hosts were very helpful when needed. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviewed by Nicole5.0★Apr 2024

"This cottage certainly lived up to its reviews."

The property was clean, comfortable and extremely well equipped. The hosts couldn’t do enough to make us feel at home and the welcome pack provided on our arrival of home made bread, cake and flowers was lovely. Certainly a property deserving of 5 stars.

Reviewed by Nicholas5.0★Apr 2024

"Great house everything you need , comfortable stay , owner made us feel very welcome, would stay again"

Reviewed by Karen5.0★Apr 2024

"A great property in a great location and really helpful hosts."

A great base to explore the wider area from.

Reviewed by Lee Richard5.0★Mar 2024

"Amazing welcome package after a 6 hour journey was simply amazing."

Homemade bread and cake, were delicious. Owners were so warm and welcoming. We loved our stay at Roger pot. The house is beautifully presented, authentic and more than we expected. Diolch from Wales. X

Reviewed by Dawn5.0★Mar 2024

"What a beautiful place Roger Pot is with fabulous hosting from Paul and Karen."

Warm welcome with the wood burner lit and an exceptional welcome pack. Cannot fault. We have an anxious mutt who is wary of large dogs and strangers but the hosts were understanding of this and ensured their (very friendly!) pooch was kept away from him. This made for a relaxing stay and for this we are grateful. The cottage is well equipped and very comfortable-slept really well! Location great for exploring the Dales and Lake District. All in all we had a lovely week- thank you!

Reviewed by Donna5.0★Mar 2024

"We had a lovely stay in this fabulous cottage."

We had everything we needed. The cottage was clean and cosy. The views were breathtaking and there was an amazing welcome pack waiting for us when we arrived

Reviewed by Carolyn5.0★Mar 2024

"Absolutely stunning property, we couldn't fault anything at all."

The house is just beautiful - very comfortable and every tiny detail has been thought out, from fresh flowers, food hamper and essentials in the fridge, to the most delicious home made Parkin made by Paul (he may have also made the Sourdough bread too which was just gorgeous). The underfloor heating downstairs was a real surprise as it was very cold and windy outside, so we were lovely and cosy and there was a constant supply of fuel for the burner too. The bedrooms are gorgeous and the bed linen was beautiful. Would also recommend a hot bath after a cold walk as it was fantastic! Paul and Karen were amazing hosts, so helpful and nothing was too much trouble, they're really lovely people. We'll definitely be back here and would highly recommend Roger Pot to anybody looking for a great getaway in a beautiful location. Thank you so much for such an amazing few days.

Reviewed by Nina5.0★Jan 2024

"We stayed at the Roger Pot over New Year."

Cottage was lovely and was exactly what we were looking for. There was a beautiful welcome basked on arrival and the owner has already lit the fire so it was nice a toasty. The cottage has a real cosy feel about it and has all you need for your stay. Beds were really comfy and the kitchen was well equipped. Beautiful views from the cottage and some lovely walks. Due to the bad weather we didn’t really leave the cottage, but there was lots of games to keep us entertained (tv is only very small). Would definitely recommend this cottage.

Reviewed by Jennifer5.0★Dec 2023

"We all really loved our stay over Christmas."

We all felt at home as soon as we stepped through the door. Credit to the owners, who put real effort into decorating for Christmas and ensuring that we had everything we needed, including fuel for the fire. This house is beautiful. It has a warm, welcoming, cosy feeling to it with a truly huge view across the valley. We could not have asked for more. It might be worth mentioning that the house is accessed via a narrow steep track with quite a steep drop to the river on one side, so you need to be a confident driver to negotiate it (my other half wouldn’t drive whilst we were here)

Reviewed by Steven4.7★Dec 2023

"What a fabulous time we had at Roger Pot."

Paul and Karen, the owners made us very welcome. Their home made goodies on arrival were such a lovely touch. The house is amazing with spectacular views. It is extremely clean and very comfortable. We loved our stay and we are just about to book again for Spring next year. To anyone thinking of booking please do you will not be disappointed

Reviewed by Rachel5.0★Nov 2023

"Rodger pot cottage is a lovely warm welcoming cottage, everything you need for a comfortable stay is there, the owners are very informative with regards to local knowledge and only there if you need them."

Spectacular views from every window with lovely walks from the door. The elevated position gives amazing views of the surrounding valley. I would highly recommend a stay in Rodger pot cottage. Thank you Paul & Karen, don’t change a thing, it’s just perfect.

Reviewed by Steven5.0★Nov 2023

"Lovely cottage in a beautiful setting."

We loved the seclusion and the fields at the back for our dog to run in. We used it as a base to visit both the Lake District (Kendal and Bowness) and the Yorkshire Moors (Malham Cove). The owner was very helpful when required. The house was very well equipped and the welcome pack was a real bonus with the loaf and ginger cake particular highlights. We would definitely stay again.

Reviewed by Rachel5.0★Oct 2023

"Beautiful cottage with stunning views."

Clean and spacious, warm and comfortable. We stayed for a week and just loved it. Owners live nearby and they welcomed us. On arrival we found dining room and fridge set up with basics (milk, bread, eggs, cake). We also found that the bread and cake were homemade by the owners (really delicious). We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviewed by Florian5.0★Oct 2023

"This is a beautiful holiday cottage."

The owners couldn’t have been more helpful but they also maintained our privacy. The views from the holiday cottages are spectacular and the cottage is comfortable and cosy. We loved it.

Reviewed by Rachel5.0★Oct 2023

"Beautiful accommodation in a very peaceful setting."

Wonderful hosts who couldn't do enough to help you make the most of your stay. Great range of guide books on walking cycling and rambling in the local area and further afield. Can't wait to return. Exquisite bedding.

Reviewed by Debbie5.0★Sep 2023

"A beautiful property in a gorgeous setting."

It was very well equipped and had absolutely everything we needed. The welcome hamper was a lovely touch. The property was clean and so comfortable to spend the whole day in, when the weather took a turn. Garsdale is well positioned for visits to the Lake District or the Yorkshire Dales.

Reviewed by Caroline5.0★Sep 2023

"Roger Pot is the nicest cottage we have stayed in."

Set in a stunning location with views in three directions the house itself is beautifully kept combining the original features with a modern feel. The appliances are all high quality and to be honest I’m not sure how it isn't rated 5 stars. The images really don’t do the place full justice, especially the master bedroom which is very spacious with low windows offering the best view there is to have from the cottage. We must mention the welcome from the owners who had provided both fresh flowers and a hamper of basics and local food. Our only gripe would be the Sykes information on the site says there is a pub within a mile which is not the case. The nearest is nearly 5 miles along a country road with no footpath. This slight disappointment aside you really can’t fault the property itself. Would thoroughly recommend this property both as a base to explore the dales and lakes or to just unwind in a beautiful, peaceful setting. As a bonus the kids (and adults) will love the sheep and two horses around the site.

Response - Thanks for the kind review Paul. We’ve put right the error regarding the pub. Thanks for pointing that out. Property Owner

Reviewed by Paul4.7★Aug 2023

  • "We had a lovely stay at Roger pot."

Beautiful location, cottage was amazing and great facilities, home from home. A good selection of games to play when the weather wasn't great. Was a nice surprise to find a welcome pack when we arrived, with all the essentials, the homemade parkin was delicious. Would highly recommend, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay, although would say very rural so a car is essential.

Reviewed by Amanda4.7★Jul 2023

  • "A lovely stay in a beautiful location."

The owners made us feel very welcome.

Reviewed by Helen5.0★Jul 2023

en.title: Booking Terms and Conditions
en.description:
You will be very welcome guests of Roger Pot and we hope that you will enjoy, as we do, the glorious peace and tranquillity of the Yorkshire Dales Garsdale Valley. Our Terms and Conditions are to protect us and you, the guest and your party, so please read and adhere to them. By paying your deposit, you are agreeing to the terms set out below:

ARRIVAL AND DEPARTURE

The earliest time of arrival is 4pm and the latest time for departure is 10am. Although we try to be as flexible as we can, this time is required to clean and service the accommodation.

GUEST OBLIGATIONS

The supervision of children, dogs and any adults requiring care remains your responsibility at all times. 

Please leave the property in a tidy condition and let us know about any breakages as soon as you can so that we can try to replace them before next arrivals. Any articles damaged or broken beyond normal wear and tear must be paid for. We reserve the right to levy a cleaning charge should the condition of the property make this necessary.

Do not allow the property to be occupied by more than the maximum number of persons stated in the booking. We count children over 2 in the numbers. We are not insured for excess numbers

Please ensure you take all due care in the house and surrounding land and be responsible for your own safety at all times.

Dogs must not be left unattended in Roger Pot at any time. They should be flea treated & wormed prior to arrival and kept under control in our grounds at all times.

Smoking and vaping is not permitted in any part of the accommodation and the guest and any member of your party agrees not to smoke or vape inside the Accommodation.

RIGHT OF ENTRY

The owner requires reasonable access to the property during your stay if it is deemed necessary; and in an emergency this may be without notice.

OUR LIABILITY

We, the owners shall not be liable to you or any members of your party for any loss or damage to person or property howsoever caused.

COMPLAINTS AND CONCERNS

Please make us aware of any complaints or concerns as soon as is reasonably possible in order to give us a chance to rectify the situation. In every case a complaint must be notified before departure. We cannot accept complaints notified after departure.

All reasonable efforts have been made to ensure that descriptions given to you in relation to the Roger Pot are accurate. You acknowledge that minor differences may arise between photographs, descriptions and illustrations and the actual property. If you have any specific requirement you are advised to confirm that requirement with us prior to booking.

RIGHT TO REFUSE

We may, at our discretion, refuse any booking.

If in our opinion any person is not suitable to continue their occupation of the property because of unreasonable behaviour, damage or nuisance to other parties, the contract may be cancelled and we may repossess the property immediately. You will remain liable for the whole cost of hire and no refund shall be due.

General Data Protection Regulation 2016

We are not a company but we confirm that all personal and other information and details collected by ourselves in the course of taking your booking will not be disclosed to any third party. If you wish to be removed from our marketing/ emailing lists, please let us know

en.title: Add This Guide To Your Phone
en.description:
When you first access this digital guidebook on your phone, follow the prompt to add it to your home screen. This makes it:

✅ faster
✅ easier to access
✅ available offline

Once on your phone it behaves just like any other app, but without you needing to download anything or sign in.

For iPhone users

The "Add to Home Screen" only appears when using Safari browser. If Safari isn't your default browser, just copy the guidebook link and paste it into Safari. From there, you can follow the prompts to add the guidebook to your home screen.

For Android users

Always get the latest version of the guidebook

Our guidebook is regularly updated with information to help you get the most out of your stay. The app automatically updates every 24 hours. If you want to get the updates sooner, simply refresh the screen. To refresh the guide, swipe the guide closed, and tap the app icon again to fully reload.

Share your guide with your group

You can send the link to this guidebook to everyone who’s travelling with you. That way, everyone has access to all the information they’ll need (which means less hassle for the trip organiser!).

en.title: Print out the Guide
en.description:
Print or Save a PDF

If you would like to print certain pages ahead of travelling, or if you'd like to save a PDF to your device, just tap the print button above. It won't print right away, but will create a PDF which you can save or print.

title_translations.en: Add This Guide To Your Phone

en.title: Things To Bring
en.description:
Whilst we provide a lot of things, you may want to consider bringing the following which we don't provide!

  • Personal toiletries
  • Camera, memory cards, chargers
  • Personal electronics chargers, adaptors as needed
  • Medication
  • Wellies/Walking boots
  • A torch (we have one in the house)
  • A good book
  • Slippers
  • Dog towel, water bowl

en.title: Starting you off
en.description:
For your convenience we will provide:

Washing up liquid, handwash and shower gels

Dishcloth, dust pan and brush, 2 tea towels, oven glove

100% bed linen

Bath and hand towels

Bath mat

Loo paper (2 rolls per toilet), sanitary bags

Wood (tops up available for small charge)

Welcome pack with home made bread and cake, biscuits, sweets, crisps, oatcake biscuits, small amount of drink sachets (tea, coffee, choc drink), jams, butter, milk, cheese and eggs

en.title: Check the Weather
en.description:
For local weather look to mwis.org.uk/forecast/english-and-welsh/yorkshire-dales-and-north-pennines

If heading over to the lakes certainly consider visiting mwis.org.uk/forecast/english-and-welsh/lake-district

en.title: Access Codes / Instructions
en.description:
A key to the front door is located in a key safe within the entrance porch

We’ll provide you with an access key code before your arrival. This will allow you to check yourself into the property. Please make sure you have received the code before you travel. If you haven’t received this before setting off, please contact us. There's nothing worse than arriving somewhere new (potentially at night) and not being able to get in!

We will however likely be home to meet and greet you on arrival and show you around. Just let us know roughly what time you expect to arrive. 

Please lock the door whenever you go out and leave the key within the key safe on your final departure

en.title: Check-in Time
en.description:
Your check-in time is 16.00

We can sometimes arrange an early check-in, so please contact us if you plan to arrive early and we'll do our best to accommodate you (we can’t promise, unfortunately).

If you are arriving early, have a look at the “Local Area Guide” section. We've listed lots of things you can do around the area while you’re waiting.

en.title: Contacting Us
en.description:
If you need to get in touch with us, (whether it's about a delay or you're lost - or anything else!) you can either phone us, text us, or email us using the details below:

Call us: Paul 07917454791 or Karen 07774586713

Text us: Paul 07917454791 or Karen 07774586713

Or Email: pbenson434@gmail.com

en.title: Driving Directions
en.description:
The address of the property is Roger Pot, Garsdale, Sedbergh, Cumbria, LA10 5PQ

From Sedbergh follow the A684 in the direction of Hawes. Continue for 6 miles, just before you cross the bridge heading into Garsdale, turn in left and there is a metal gate, with the sign 'Roger Pot'. Drive up the track and the house is at the end of the track.  Depending upon your direction of travel the post code slightly overshoots or undershoots the roadside gateway. If you use W3W the gateway can be located at ///pounds.homing.interlude

One of Tthe easiest way to get directions is by using the map, which you can access by tapping here. You'll also find the MAP option in the menu at the bottom of your screen. Once on the map you'll see a blue house icon bouncing into position. This is where you are staying. Simply click it and then click "get directions". It will open Google Maps and the end point (where you're staying!) will be filled in. You simply need to type in your starting point.

en.title: Kitchen Equipment
en.description:
All devices should be fairly straightforward to use. Paper copies of the instruction manuals are stored in the drawer under the microwave. For web copies please go to https://1drv.ms/f/s!AmXhwTQEY9NjhKtkHrusrs8dVzxtZw?e=j1RK5x. Here are some specifics you might want to know:

The dishwasher: we have left you some dishwasher tablets in the cupboard under the sink

The hob and oven: the oven is all electric. It has an induction hob which means only the induction friendly types of metal pots and pans will operate 

Extract fan: Please note that this doesn't come on automatically with the light. The switch is behind the toaster. Please do remember to switch off when finished in the kitchen

en.title: Heating
en.description:
LPG heating – The LPG boiler is no longer in use. The bolier should not be touched please

Lounge log fire heating and hot water – the multifuel burner has a back boiler which heats water circulating through the house. If the fire is lit it will automatically heat the hot water and heat the house through underfloor heating on the ground floor and the panel radiators on the first floor. We will provide a basket of logs on arrival. Top-ups are available at a cost of £10/basket (top ups are free in the winter)

Panel electric radiators - We have transitioned to all electric for heating and you will see panel radiators in each of the rooms. The are set to a comfort temp of 18 degrees.  The LPG panels remain and will operate when the lounge fire is operating (adjust their temp individually in the usual way via the TRV). Please do not attempt to dry clothes on or too near to the panel radiators as this potentially may cause a fire hazard

en.title: Laundry Appliances
en.description:
The washing machine/dryer can be found in the utility

It is a standard format machine so fairly straightforward to operate. However, if in any doubt about, there are instructions to be found in a drawer next to the machine. There is a wirlygig clothes dryer outside and a small clothes horse in the meter cupboard next to the sink

For Washing machine manual go to https://1drv.ms/f/s!AmXhwTQEY9NjhKtkHrusrs8dVzxtZw?e=j1RK5x

en.title: Cleaning equipment
en.description: Should you find the need to clean while you are at the property we have provided all the tools you should need. In the utility meter cupboard there is a hoover, bucket and mop. Under the sink we have provided cleaning products. The toilets are supplied with septic tank friendly toilet solutions.

en.title: Hot water
en.description: Hot water -  Hot water is generally heated via the emersion heater located in the locked cupboard in the main bathroom. Water will also be heated via the lounge fire when lit. The emersion heater is on a constant heat setting so there should be no need to consider turning it on or off

en.title: Septic Tank
en.description:
The property has benefited from a recently installed septic tank/treatment plant. This requires minimal maintenance providing people follow one simple request:

Please please don't put anything down the loo other than the obvious and toilet paper 

Your help with this is really truly appreciated!

en.title: Television
en.description:
Lounge TV

There is a manual for the LV TV, but I know you probably won’t want to read it, but here is a quick start guide. Turn on TV and it will take you to the home page. If it doesn't just press 'house' picture on controller where you will then see some adverts for programmes and a row of TV for you to select from. This will work for BBC, ITV and Channel 4 and channel. All other Apps you have to sign in using your private subscription details. If the App you require is not on the home screen simply click on the App icon and select the App you require

Bedroom 1 TV

The TV in Bed 1 has a Roku device only which will allow you to watch your own subscription channels and also catch up on free channels, BBC, All Four, Channel 5, Sky News, and a few others.  Once you have switched on the TV please refer to Roku TV guide below

 

Roku TV

A Roko device is attached to the Bed 1 TV set at Roger Pot

Rather than give you a large manual I have the following information which you may find useful

When you turn on the TV it will take you to a guest page.  You enter the date of your departure and it will take you to the home screen.  All your settings and passwords will be automatically deleted from the Ruko on the day you depart or you can go into settings from the home page and click on guest, Delete guest and it will delete all your settings

When you first go into the home page you will see that there are apps already downloaded for use of your own subscriptions.  You can find more apps relevant to your subscriptions in the home page, Apps.  You can then download your selection, sign in and watch as you would on your normal tv or laptop etc

Instructions on how to use the remote are attached but you can also download the Ruko Remote app from an app store (i.e. Google App) which will allow you to listen to the TV via your mobile with headphones and voice control

For Apple devices there is an app obtainable from the Home page, Apps, that you can download to use your Apple phone which you may find useful

All other manuals can be found in the kitchen drawer under the microwave

For TV and Ruku manuals go to: https://1drv.ms/f/s!AmXhwTQEY9NjhKtkHrusrs8dVzxtZw?e=j1RK5x

en.title: Music System
en.description:
You’re more than welcome to use our sound system. You can connect any device via bluetooth. We ask you to be mindful about volumes, especially early in the morning and late at night.

For Hifi manual go to: https://1drv.ms/f/s!AmXhwTQEY9NjhKtkHrusrs8dVzxtZw?e=j1RK5x

en.title: Lighting a fire
en.description:
Lighting a fire adds a very cosy feel to the house and it warms all the rooms too!

If you've never had to light a fire before simple scrunch up some paper and lay in the bottom of the burner with some kindling and place larger logs on top.  Pull out the stopper button to let the burner breath and light the fire. Once the fire is up and going you can retract the stopper button. Close the doors on the burner at all times. Let the fire burn down to a glow and then reload as required. Dont overload fire. When fully extinguished empty the trays below the burner into the ash bucket and when full give us a shout and we will dispose. Always use the glove provided as it all gets very very hot. The stove pipe is extremely hot and you should avoid touching at all costs. We have provided a fire guard to protect small people and animals from getting around the fire. Please don't attempt to dry clothes or towels on or near the fire. Do take care!

en.title: Chairs / Tables
en.description: There is a dining table and chairs outside. Cushions are stored in the utility meter cupboard. Please place cushions back in the utility meter cupboard when not in use

en.title: BBQ's
en.description: We don't supply any BBQ equipment but we don't mind you bringing your own if you'd like. We would only ask that you ensure any BBQ you use has suitable off the floor legs (so as not to scorch the grass) and you consider the risk of fire to the surrounding tall wild grasses

en.title: Torch
en.description: It can get very dark in the Yorkshire Dales at night (we are after all a dark skies location). It's worth remembering this when coming to/from the property in the late evening. A torch is provided in the left hand drawer to the lounge console table adjacent the front door

en.title: Wirlygig
en.description: Feel free to use the wirlygig but please do remember to put the cover back on when not in use. Thanks

en.title: Bins
en.description:
The bins are located at the main road gate. We would suggest simply leaving your bagged rubbish outside the front door on departure or take it to the roadside bins if convenient. No loose rubbish should be placed in any of the bins. Please always use rubbish bags. Extra rubbish bags can be located at the bottom of the in-house bins

We are required to recycle our waste into three categories; general waste, recyled plastic and tin and lastly glass

en.title: Bottled water
en.description: Whilst the water supply at Roger Pot is treated and tested safe annually it is sourced from a nearby well and therefore cannot realistically be completely guaranteed. We therefore supply bottled water for you to use for drinking and cooking should you wish. Bottled water is stored under the sink and small bottles (with glasses) are also supplied in each of the bathrooms.  Free top-ups are available during your stay if and when required

en.title: Cars
en.description:
Cars – parking is limited on the site so please try to be mindful, as we will be, to allow space for other to manoeuvre for entry and exit. You will have also experienced the track up to the house so again please be mindful that there are no turning places should you meet someone coming up or going down. Preferably please text one of the numbers on the gate each time you drive up, we will do the same. Reversing is possible but not preferable!  Avoid also texting when you’re coming down as this will just confuse.

EV charging - If you have an electric car we are happy for you to charge it with your own extension lead. We only ask that you tell us in advance, take a meter reading before and after charging so we can record your upload. We will only charge for your use at the rates we pay

en.title: Horses
en.description: Our three horses Silver, Niels and Opal live in the barn and occupy the four acres surrounding the property. They are managed by the owners who live above them in the upper floor of the barn. The ponies are well-behaved but can be boisterous with each other so try not to get between them if you are saying hello. We prefer you don’t feed them. Opal has a horse diabetes (laminitis) and you will see her grazing with a muzzle to restrict her grass intake. Please shut all gates. There is sometimes an electrical pony tape around the fields. These are generally not electrified unless we are experiencing trouble with one of our horses escaping (one in particular comes to mind!). Rest assured If electrified we will tell you. If we didn’t the worst you would experience is a small shock, but well tell you…honest!

en.title: Sheep
en.description: We sometimes allow our farming neighbour to come onto our land to graze it down. When on the land the black metal gate (bottom of our field) will sometimes be left open and an electric pony tape may be strung across the gateway (to stop horses only). Generally the power to the fencing will be off and we would tell you if we decided to electrify

en.title: Garsdale
en.description: Historically, Garsdale was a chapelry in the ancient parish of Sedbergh in the Ewecross wapentake in the West Riding of Yorkshire. In 1866 it became a separate civil parish. From 1894 to 1974 it was part of Sedbergh Rural District. In 1974 it became part of the new county of Cumbria. In the 2001 census the parish had a population of 202 decreasing at the 2011 census to 191. Garsdale is on the western slopes of the Pennines, between Baugh Fell to the north, and Rise Hill to the south. It is within the Yorkshire Dales National Park. The dale is the valley of the Clough River, which rises on the north eastern slopes of Baugh Fell and flows through Grisedale, the Dale that Died, as Grisedale Beck until it becomes the Clough River at Garsdale Head.

en.title: Main LPG stop valve
en.description: As LPG for the house has been discontinued you should have no need to consider any aspect of the system. The system is temporarily retained as a back up. If there is a concern, the LPG valve is located outside the back door, turn left up the steps and the valve is just on the left. Alternatively the LPG tanks can be isolated at source. The four upright cylinders are located beside the front door to the owners adjacent premises; Tarn Rigg Settle

en.title: Power
en.description: The electric meter and fuse board is located in the meter cupboard in the utility room (door directly oposite as you enter the utility room). There are two meters; the one on the left wall is a solar panel meter and can be ignored. The house meter is the one on the back wall of the meter cupboard

en.title: Water stopcock
en.description: This is located in the cupboard under the stairs. The door is locked. Please contact the owner for any emergency needing the water shut off

en.title: Spare bulbs or batteries
en.description: Replacement bulbs and batteries can be provided on request from the owners

en.title: Inventory
en.description: The following items will be in Roger Pot when you arrive. Please do let us know if anything is missing or if you feel there is anything we should add

en.title: Great links
en.description:
Its worth popping over to the Yorkshire Dales National Park Authority 'Plan your visit' section. This provides great info on places to visit, public transport, walking routes and countryside safety and accessibility

https://www.yorkshiredales.org.uk/plan-your-visit/

en.title: Crackpot Hall and Upper Swaledale
en.description:
6 miles/9.6km | 3.5 hours | moderate

Yearning for wide open spaces? This wonderful high-level walk meanders past a storied ruin and ends at an attractive waterfall in a little-visited, yet glorious pocket of the Yorkshire Dales.

The walk starts in the little village of Muker in the heart of Swaledale, a lush green valley with a patchwork of tiny fields and barns. This has never been one of the more popular tourist dales, but our walk takes in the area at its best and most dramatic.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-crackpot-hall-north-yorkshire

en.title: Dentdale
en.description:
2.5 miles/4km | 1.5 hours | easy

The Yorkshire Dales contains most of Britain’s surviving upland hay meadows, traditionally farmed to allow wildlife to thrive. Dentdale is one of these valleys, divided into a patchwork of idyllic stone-walled fields colourfully blanketed in wildflowers in spring and summer.

Starting from the narrow, cobbled streets of Dent, take time on this walk to look down on species such as meadow buttercup, eyebright and red clover, but also to gaze up at the lofty hills, rising to the highest points in both Yorkshire and Lancashire.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/dentdale

en.title: Grassington
en.description:
8 miles/12.8km | 4.5 hours | moderate

The countryside around the Yorkshire Dales village of Grassington is dotted with pools and falls, making it an idyllic location for a spot of wild swimming. In the meadows south of Grassington, families mess about in rubber dinghies, skip over stepping-stones and throw themselves down water chutes.

Nearby Ghaistrill’s Strid offers exhilarating rapids, while Loup Scar tempts the more intrepid with a high jump and plunge pool. Enjoy all of the above on this riverside ramble along the banks of the Wharfe.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-grassington-north-yorkshire

en.title: Hawes, Aysgill Force and Hardraw Force
en.description:
7 miles/11.3km | 5 hours | moderate

Hardraw Force is England's highest single-drop waterfall. Visit a series of enchanting waterfalls on this 7-mile walk, starting and ending in the Yorkshire Dales village of Hawes

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/hawes-aysgill-force-and-hardraw-force-north-yorkshire

en.title: Howgill Fells
en.description:
9.6 miles/15.5km | 5–7 hours | challenging

This challenging walk in the north-western corner of the Yorkshire Dales begins in the village of Sedbergh and climbs into Howgill Fells – take a break on The Calf, with staggering views west over the Cumbria landscape and east over North Yorkshire.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-howgill-fells-cumbria

en.title: Ingleborough
en.description:
4 miles/6.4km | 2.5 hours | moderate

Walk the second highest peak in the Yorkshire Dales, a mountain pockmarked with cavernous sinkholes, rumbling rivers and labyrinthine limestone paving. This 8-mile route to the summit and back takes you to a mysterious chasm and a famous pothole.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-ingleborough-yorkshire

en.title: Keld to Tan Hill Inn
en.description:
10.2 miles/16.5km | 6 hours |moderate

On a lonely site high in the Yorkshire Dales stands a unique and historic place. With its exposed beams, stone-flagged floor and welcoming fire, the Tan Hill Inn, Britain’s highest public house at 528m (1,732ft), is a place where walkers brush shoulders with inquisitive tourists.

This walk takes you from Keld to the head of Arkengarthdale on the edge of Swaledale, where winds rush across moorland, and where you can stop at the warm pub to refuel or rest your weary head.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-keld-to-tan-hill-inn-north-yorkshire

en.title: Malham Tarn
en.description:
3.6 miles/5.8km | 2 hours |easy-moderate

This short walk around Malham Tarn, beneath the looming cliffs of Great Close Scar, offers ramblers a chance to experience a variety of habitats, from craggy limestone bluffs, to thick forest, dark peatland and a wildlife-rich upland lake.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-malham-tarn-north-yorkshire

en.title: Muker - going east
en.description:
6.8 miles/11km | 4 hours |moderate

Muker's landscape is largely unchanged from the late-18th and early 19th century, and those iconic features of the Dales – the field barns and the drystone walls – radiate from the village.

Muker is also famous for its species-rich hay meadows. In late spring, these meadows burst into life – a colour bonanza best absorbed after a cup of Yorkshire tea and a slice of cake. This splendid 7-mile circular route starts at Muker and follows the River Swale east to the village of Gunnerside

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-muker-swaledale-north-yorkshire

en.title: Settle to Stainforth
en.description:
8.5 miles/13.7km | 5 hours |moderate

Settle Up’ and ‘Settle Down’ proclaim the platform benches as you step off the train at Settle’s lovingly restored station, gateway to the pretty little market town and a landscape rich in gleaming limestone scars, caves and potholes.

This 8.5-mile circular walking route starts in Settle, venturing beneath Attermire Scar and beyond Catrigg Force to Stainforth, before returning to Settle via Stainforth Force.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/settle-to-stainforth-yorkshire

en.title: Smardale Beck
en.description:
7 miles/11.3km | 4 hours | moderate

An old viaduct, built in 1861, rises almost 30m on 14 stone arches above Smardale Beck – it’s a fine vantage point for spotting all-year-round residents to the national nature reserve, such as sparrowhawks, buzzards and treecreepers. Enjoy a spectacular 7-mile walk through a secluded gorge in the Yorkshire Dales National Park.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/smardale-gill-cumbria

en.title: Upper Wharfedale
en.description:
6.9 miles/11.2km | 4 hours | moderate

Upper Wharfedale is a charming little valley off the beaten track where the roads are too narrow for trucks and busses to navigate. It’s a bit of a bind to get to, but once you’ve found the dale, you’ll never forget it.

The limestone and peat uplands hereabouts are riven with steep-sided valleys and ghylls where water teems off the fells and tumbles over a series of waterfalls through the heart of the picturesque villages of Cray, Yockenthwaite and Hubberholme.

https://www.countryfile.com/go-outdoors/walks/walk-upper-wharfedale-north-yorkshire

en.title: Morecambe Beach
en.description: A dog friendly beach is also available at Morecombe at Marine Road East, Morecombe LA4 5AH.

en.title: Buses
en.description:
The Little White Bus: the Garsdale Station Shuttle bus (between Gasdale Head Station and Hawes) provides a scheduled service to meet trains at 12.07, 12.22, 14.40 and 14.50. There is no need to book if you are arriving or departing on these trains. The Little White Bus runs trips to local places of interest throughout the year and can be booked to drop off or collect specific parties from and to Garsdale for a modest fee (note this doesnt come down to the village)

Stagecoach run a daily service to Penrith setting off from opposite Sedbergh library at 9am. This service goes through Kerby Stephen and various small villages before arriving in Penrith. A very scenic route and ideal for a big shopping trip too! Details and timetables will be upload here soon but can viewed on-line or in the Sedbergh library window

Garsdale village services – it is understood that a call response service is available from the Little White Bus – details to follow

en.title: Home deliveries
en.description: Home deliveries are available to the property from Tesco, Morrisons, Asda and Sainsburys. Their vans are too large to get up the track (albeit some have done it!) so we tend to meet them with the car at the gate

en.title: Powells Fruit Merchants
en.description: Great greengrocers

en.title: Sedbergh market
en.description:
Farmers Market every Wednesday 8.30am to 12.30pm 

Artisan Market Saturday once a month during summer months (keep an eye out)

en.title: The Market House Hawes
en.description: Indoor market first Saturday every month

en.title: The Black Bull Inn
en.description:
Dog friendly pub restaurant. 

'At The Black Bull in Sedbergh you’ll find an exciting and unique menu,

designed with influences taken from Japanese and German cuisine'

en.title: The Dalesman Country Inn
en.description: Pub restaurant. No site parking. Not dog friendly

en.title: The Green Dragon Inn
en.description: Excellent old pub/restaurant. Fronts on to Hardraw force waterfall. Parking on site. Dog Friendly

en.title: The White Hart Inn, Hawes
en.description: Excellent pub/restaurant and very dog friendly. Park in town and walk to venue

en.title: The Chippie
en.description: Best you'll find around

en.title: The Meat Hook Sedbergh
en.description: Butchers

en.title: Jhoots Pharmacy, Sedbergh
en.description: Jhoots Pharmacy

en.title: Royal Lancaster Infirmary, Lancaster
en.description: The Royal Lancaster Infirmary (RLI) has a range of 'general hospital' services, including a full Accident & Emergency Department, Critical Care unit and Consultant led beds. RLI also provides a range of planned care including outpatients, diagnostics, therapies, day-case and inpatient surgery.

en.title: Westmorland General Hospital, Kendal
en.description: This houses an Urgent Treatment Centre. Use this department if you need urgent medical attention, but it's not a life-threatening situation.

en.title: Dalehead Garage, Hawes
en.description: Community owned petrol station

title_translations.en: Your Local Area Guide to getting about, walking, shopping and activities

en.title: WiFi / Internet Details
en.description:
There is free Wi-Fi in the property. The details are:

Wifi name: Roger Pot Guest

Password: !Garsdale1

We provide this service for your enjoyment and convenience. However, please note that you are responsible for its safe and appropriate use and compliance with all laws. If there is any loss of service, please contact us.

We would be grateful if you could refrain from plugging any ethernet cables into the router as this has been known to cause damage to the router

en.title: Mobile coverage
en.description:
Ofcom rate mobile coverage for voice and data as follows

EE - Limited for both voice and data

Three - Likely for voice, Limited for data

O2 - Likely for voice and data

Vodafone - Likely for voice and data

We have vodafone and find we have excellent coverage at 4G speed

en.title: Quiet Times
en.description: We are located in a friendly and welcoming community and, although this is a holiday destination, it's home to other people. As such we ask that you respect their privacy and their right to a peaceful existence! Specifically, between the hours of 10 PM and 8 AM noise should be kept to a minimum.

en.title: Breakages
en.description: We understand that sometimes accidents happen! Should you break anything, please let us know immediately - if it's minor we usually won't charge. If it's a larger issue (e.g. the TV screen!) we would like to agree the cost with you before you leave to avoid any issues later. Thank you!

en.title: Smoking Policy
en.description: This is a smoke-free home. Feel free to smoke or Vape outside the house but we would be grateful if you retained carefully extinguished cigarette butts and disposed of same in the bin

en.title: Pets
en.description:
We welcome pets as per your booking, please respect these following simple requests to keep our home enjoyable for everybody 

Please keep pets off the beds, furniture, and windowsills. If you think your pet is likely to ignore this when you are not looking (!), please bring adequate throws, blankets and sheets to cover up things. Please accept that you as the owner take responsibility for the additional cleaning and sweeping of the living areas that may result from your pet at the end of the stay i.e fouling, chewing and especially moulting. 
 
Please do keep dogs on leads or under control when walking the public footpaths and fields. There are sheep and horses surrounding the property
 
If you wish to wash your dog, there is a hosepipe to use with an outside tap and a bucket in the utility meter cupboard.  Please do not wash your dog in the bath as this is acrylic and will scratch.
 
The dog waste goes in the bin and poo bags are provided for this purpose. Perhaps collect them up during your stay and deposit in the bin on departure (please don't bring into the house)
 
We're sorry but dogs must not be left alone in the property at any time
 
We work very hard to ensure our property is clean and tidy for your stay. Your co-operation will ensure we have enough time to prepare the cottage for the next guests, and that we can continue to accept dogs without an additional charge.

en.title: What to do in an Emergency
en.description:
For emergency services (ambulance, police, fire), call 999

Do not delay if you feel an emergency situation has arisen. State your location as the address on the front page of this guidebook.

In case of a fire

  • Exit the property as quickly as possible
  • Ensure that all persons are accounted for

Do not attempt to re-enter the building until a Fire Officer states that it is safe to do so.

Fire extinguishers are provided within the property but you should only attempt to extinguish a small fire if you believe it is safe to do so

In the case of a serious health issue

Dial 999 for any emergency. The ambulance service will take around 20 minutes to arrive at Roger Pot and then the emergency personnel will walk up the drive to you (Vans are too large for our track). 

If the issue is a non-emergency health matter and you need medical help or advice fast you should call 111. They can also help if you are not sure what action to take.

Defibrilator - a defribrilator is positioned on the external wall of the village hall (bottom of the track turn left and it's on the left). Once you arrive at the installation, dial 999 and they will talk you through the process. 

First Responders - Garsdale and Sedbergh are covered by a volunteer first responder service. To engage, simply call 999 (or 111 if unsure) and they will send first responders if it's considered suitable 

Notify the property owners at the earliest convenient time of any emergency

Our nearest doctor is Sedbergh Medical Centre, Station Road, Sedbergh, LA10 5DL  Phone 01539 718191

Our nearest dentist is Sedbergh Dental Practice, 45-47 Main Street, Sedbergh, LA10 5BL Phone: 015396 20626

A first Aid kit can be located in second drawer of the utility room cupboard unit

en.title: Possible risks
en.description:
Roger Pot is safe but like any home there are things to be aware of...

  • River can be wild during periods of high rain fall. Children should be accompanied at all times
  • Horses on site (Silver, Niels and Opal) - they are very friendly but can be boisterous
  • Slippery steps in winter (front and back). A supply of salt grit will be available
  • The wood burner has an extremely hot stove pipe. Do use the guard (stored behind the sofa) when small people and animals are around. Please don't attempt to dry things on or near the stove

en.title: Thank You For Staying With Us
en.description:
Thank you for staying with us, and we hope you enjoyed your stay.

If there were any issues with your stay, please don't hesitate to tell us, as we want to ensure we can resolve them for the next guest.

We love online reviews!

If you decide to leave a review please give us a star rating, and write a sentence or two about what you liked the best during your stay.

Was it the comfy bed? The detailed information and local recommendations? Or maybe the location itself?

If you are unable to leave us 5 stars, please don't hesitate to contact us first to let us know why - you are key to helping us improve. We take all feedback onboard.

Thank you!

en.title: Check-out Time
en.description:
Check-out time is strictly 10am

If you require a later check-out, we’ll do our best to accommodate it. But please bear in mind you’ll need to let us know beforehand.

If we have guests arriving that day it will be almost impossible to offer a late check-out due to the cleaners needing to prepare for those guests.

en.title: Check-out Process
en.description:
Before your departure, we’d appreciate if you would take care of the following:

  • Strip used beds (including removal of first layers of mattress protection and pillow protection and place all bedding in the lounge
  • Place used towels in the shower
  • Empty the dishwasher and pop things away
  • Empty all the trash (bags can be left outside the front door)
  • Collect up those dog poops!
  • Close/Lock all doors & windows

We hope you had a wonderful stay and wish you safe travels back home!

en.title: Looking to Book Again?
en.description: We would love to have you stay again! Please get in touch anytime to check availability or special offers.
